timeline.bodyText: Hmm, so Mob or Hoglin interface etc cannot be used? Good note

 		ARG 1 levelTypeProvider
 	METHOD method_12208 createBlockEntity (Lnet/minecraft/class_2338;)Lnet/minecraft/class_2586;
 		ARG 1 pos
-	METHOD method_12210 getEntities (Ljava/lang/Class;Lnet/minecraft/class_238;Ljava/util/List;Ljava/util/function/Predicate;)V
+	METHOD method_12210 collectEntitiesByClass (Ljava/lang/Class;Lnet/minecraft/class_238;Ljava/util/List;Ljava/util/function/Predicate;)V
+		COMMENT Collects a list of entities of some runtime type and appends them to the given list. The type of
+		COMMENT the collected entities will be a subclass of the given class.
+		COMMENT
+		COMMENT @throws IllegalArgumentException If {@code entityClass} is an interface or is not a subclass

replies.bodyText: That is correct, the method eventually calls TypeFilterableList#getAllOfType, which checks for compatibility using Class#isAssignableFrom. (Class#isAssignableFrom checks for assignment compatibility, so Entity = LivingEntity is ok, but Entity = Hoglin is not)
replies.author: kvverti

Apply suggestions from code review

timeline.bodyText: "surrounding" is really a bad name for this
timeline.author: Earthcomputer

replies.bodyText: I'd say getEntitiesWithin or some amalgamation of that since the box specifies the volume to search within.
replies.author: i509VCB

timeline.bodyText: Type arguments are erased at runtime, how would this make a difference? The heap pollution thing at first glance sounds like a load of rubbish, can you clarify precisely under what conditions this can occur?
timeline.author: Earthcomputer

replies.bodyText: After a short discussion in discord, this could be fixed by clarifying the wording slightly, from "bad casts" to "unchecked casts". What this is really stating is the obvious, that trying to put this in a List<LivingEntity> can contain other entities.
